message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CV 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a new way to improve the efficiency of the REINFORCE training process by integrating domain-specific rules in instance selection. It also uses reinforcement learning to train an agent to determine the value of instances and construct a new bag with less noisy instances. 

It could also belong to cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with distant supervision, a common technique in natural language processing. 

Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it uses a machine learning approach to solve a problem. 

It may also fall under cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as instance selection is a common task in information retrieval. 

Finally, it could be classified under cs.CV (Computer Vision) as instance selection is also a common task in image processing and computer vision.
